intro: Clinopodium fruticosum, commonly known as creeping thyme, is a low-growing perennial herb native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically forms dense mats of small, oval-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are usually pink or purple, arranged in clusters at the ends of the stems. Clinopodium fruticosum is well adapted to rocky and dry soils, making it a common sight in meadows and along pathways.
